result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Lee Reyes

records.addlTxt: to CANCEL material witness warrant, signed and filed.
to cancel material witness warrant, filed.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Ricardo Lee Reyes.  Student Intern Bailey Groh-Rasmussen under the supervision of Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Jury Trial. 

Defense counsel advises that there has been a change in circumstances and the parties are now in a resolution posture. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and filed: Affidavit.
Received and filed: material witness warrant for the following witnesses for today's scheduled jury trial: Tamara L.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Ricardo Lee Reyes.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Jury Trial. Defendant's appearance has been waived for the purpose of first call. State requests a material witness warrant, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court will file and sign the material witness warrant. Parties further prepared to proceed. Court  passes case to address court calendar.
Received and Filed. States Motion for Forfeiture By Wrongdoing as to both 22CF1190 and 21CF100.pdf

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appeared by video for Ricardo Lee Reyes.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Court to address the State's joinder motion and 911 motion on the day of trial. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/10/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, filed.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Ricardo Lee Reyes.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Case set for a final pre-trial and jury trial to go along with defendant's pending felony matter. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
of forfeiture by wrongdoing, filed.
for joinder, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray; both appear by video.  Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: DA Investigator K. Kopcha. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Return on doctor's report held. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. Court REINSTATES previous bail with all the same conditions. Case is set for a preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
signed and filed.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court temporarily STAYS the proceedings.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set over to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for cause.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in court by video with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke who appears in person.  Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense has filed a motion to withdraw.   Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Received and Filed. Motion to Withdraw and Reappoint
Letter regarding this case and defendant.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defense requests and adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with T.K.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Ricardo Lee Reyes in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricardo Lee Reyes appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defense motion to dismiss argue counts 1 and 2. Denied by the court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea


  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
